document_data.name: Yearning for the Moon
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Yearning for the Moon''''' was a [[book]] of accords penned ''circa'' the creation of the [[shadow-cursed Lands]] in [[1392 DR]].

{{Quote|''So much has changed in our fair town. The moon used to shine so brightly here. We'd all stand out, our shoulders bared, our faces unturned, drinking in the blessings like milk.''|Excerpt from ''Queen of Ravens.''}}
document_data.Content: The book's [[Selûnite]] author wrote about how the ''shadow-curse'' enveloped the town of [[Reithwin]] at the foot of the [[Moonrise Towers]]. It talks about the town slowly changing and, even the moon stopping shining at night and the inhabitants turning to worshiping [[Shar]]. The Selûnite felt like he was the last sane person in Reithwin as he watched the waning moon in secret late at night.
